details.Allegations: CUSTOMER ALLEGES THAT REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE MADE A RECOMMENDATION TO PURCHASE A MUTUAL FUND THAT WAS UNSUITABLE FOR HIS INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES.

alerts.description: Customer dispute on 12/17/2008. Resolution: Denied. Allegations: CUSTOMER ALLEGES THAT REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE MADE A RECOMMENDATION TO PURCHASE A MUTUAL FUND THAT WAS UNSUITABLE FOR HIS INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES.. Damage requested: $391,252.00. Settlement: Not specified

details.Allegations: CUSTOMER ALLEGES THAT REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE DID NOT EXPLAIN THE LIQUIDITY RISKS FOR AUCTION RATE SECURITIES.
details.Broker Comment: THIS MATTER INVOLVES THE SALE OF AUCTION RATE SECURITIES (ARS). THE TRANSACTION(S) AT ISSUE TOOK PLACE BEFORE MID-FEBRUARY 2008, WHEN THE ARS MARKET SUFFERED WIDESPREAD AUCTION FAILURES AND ILLIQUIDITY. THE REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE DID NOT CAUSE, CONTRIBUTE OR HAVE ANY CONTROL WHATSOEVER OVER THESE MARKET EVENTS. THE FIRM VOLUNTARILY REPURCHASED ARS FOR THEIR FULL PAR VALUE FROM CERTAIN CLIENTS, INCLUDING THE INSTANT CLIENT, WHETHER THEY COMPLAINED OR NOT. THE REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE WAS NOT A PARTY TO THAT AGREEMENT, DID NOT MAKE ANY PAYMENTS TO THE CLIENT, AND WAS NOT ASKED TO AND DID NOT CONTRIBUTE TO THE REPURCHASE AMOUNT. THE SETTLEMENT AMOUNT IN ITEM 11 ABOVE REFLECTS THE PAR VALUE OF THE REPURCHASED ARS, AS REQUIRED BY FINRA REGULATORY NOTICE 09-12.

alerts.description: Customer dispute on 7/8/2008. Resolution: Settled. Allegations: CUSTOMER ALLEGES THAT REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE DID NOT EXPLAIN THE LIQUIDITY RISKS FOR AUCTION RATE SECURITIES.. Damage requested: $600,000.00. Settlement: $600,000.00
